title: How do I include an "equalization payment" in the FL-160?
question: Do I include it as an amount in the body of the Fl-160, if so, under community or separate property. Do i under the other assets and debts?
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Community property in divorce,Separate property in a divorce,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Divorce and family,Family law,Marital property
answers: The FL-160 is used to state your community and separate property declarations. An equalization payment is one that is awarded by judgment or stipulation of the parties after adjudication or settlement of the division of community property items. If there is an equalization payment ordered, then it should be included in the stipulation or judgment and does not need to be stated on the FL-160. Seek legal assistance.

That's a good question.

Why don't you put in under Line 20 "Other Assets" and label it exactly what it is: "Equalization Payment from Petitioner to Respondent"?
